thread.title: Harriers give their best for home fans
thread.title_full: Harriers give their best for home fans

author: Bruce Olson, Editor
title: Harriers give their best for home fans
text: Harriers give their best for home fans Comment Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 1:35 PM By Bruce Olson, Editor Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 1:35 PM The Montevideo cross country teams acquited themselves well against qualify competition in their only home meet of the season on Tuesday at The Crossings golf course. The Montevideo girls finished second behind Lac qui Parle Valley/Dawson-Boyd. The Eagles are the state’s fourth-ranked Class Ateam. Finishing in the top 10 for Montevideo were Claire Sulflow, third; Emma Stu­eck, seventh; and Mollie Varpness, ninth. The Thunder Hawks were third in the boys meet, trailing a strong Class AA Marshall team and a Lac qui Parle Valley/Dawson-Boyd team that is ranked 10th in Class A. The Thunder Hawks’ Kurt TeBeest, who is ranked 12th individually in Class A, won the boys race by nearly 30 seconds. Marshall runners took the next four spots, with Montevideo sophomore Josh Tastad finishing strong to place sixth. Bryce Nelson was second in the JV boys race, and Aaron Roelike was fourth in the junior high run. Addie Opdahl finished third in the junior high girls run, and Aurora Wymar was fourth in the JV race. Last Thursday, the Thun­der Hawks competed in the YME Invitational at Granite Falls. Both Monte­video teams were second to Lac qui Parle Valley-Dawson-Boyd. TeBeest took top honors in the boys meet. The Thunder Hawks will compete in the Benson Invitational on Monday. The Benson Golf Club will also be the site of the West Central Conference meet on Oct. 20. By Bruce Olson, Editor
